moves.1... e6: i wondered about this for a while, most people do not do e6 where i play so i have not seen it in a while
moves.2. Nf3 d5: i figure he is doing a black form of stonewall.
moves.3. exd5 exd5 4. Qe2+: i figured i would try center counter (for white)
moves.5. d4 Nf6 6. Ne5: i did not want his knight at g4
moves.6... O-O 7. Qf3: did not want my queen on the open file, i figured his rook would go there soon so i better leave
moves.9. Bf4 Re8: well the knight is lost i better just cut my loses and go
moves.10. O-O Nxe5 11. dxe5 Bxe5 12. c3: i do not want to see Bd4
moves.12... Bg4 13. Qg3 Bxf4 14. Qxf4 c5 15. N: i let the past 2 pawns fal so i could set things up for a mating attack
moves.22... Qxc3 23. Re3: perfect now i can get this going
moves.24... Qb6 25. Kh1: i did want him to get any ideas with my f2 pawn
moves.26... Ne8: another offer and good guard against mate
moves.28. Qg4 b5 29. Ng5: still going on this attack, almost ready to end this
moves.29... Qh6: good move but it exposes the f7 pawn
moves.30. Qf5: now the black queen is pinned to stopping the mate
moves.30... g6: i think kxg7 is a mistake here actually but i may be wrong
moves.31. Qxf7+ Kh8: here i know that i should have played rh3 pinning the queen and getting me a stratigic advantage, but i did not see it then. This would have been a great end, 31.....   Rh3  32 Qxh3...  Qf8   nice and perfect, but alas i am blind
moves.32. Qxe8+ Rxe8 33. Nf7+ Kg7 34. Nxh6 Kxh: remember those pawns i lost to set this up, yeh now i regret it.
